location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 1397 from William Henry Wathen, Chief Secretary to Government, Political Department at Bombay Castle, to David Wilson, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter discusses briefly the declining power of the Imam of Muskat [Muscat] in the face of growing Wahabee [Wahhābī] influence in the area. It is implied that the Imam's standing should be protected, but no war should be entered into unless his total downfall is threatened.
